014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.io.Closeable;
017import java.lang.reflect.Type;
018import java.sql.Connection;
019import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
020import java.sql.ResultSet;
021import java.sql.SQLException;
022import java.sql.Statement;
023import java.time.Instant;
024import java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit;
025import java.util.ArrayList;
026import java.util.Arrays;
027import java.util.Collections;
028import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Map;
031import java.util.Optional;
032import java.util.Set;
033import java.util.stream.Collector;
034
035import javax.annotation.Nullable;
036
037import org.jdbi.v3.core.CloseException;
038import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
039import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument;
040import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Arguments;
041import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayArgumentStrategy;
042import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayType;
043import org.jdbi.v3.core.array.SqlArrayTypes;
044import org.jdbi.v3.core.collector.JdbiCollectors;
045import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
046import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.JdbiConfig;
047import org.jdbi.v3.core.extension.ExtensionMethod;
048import org.jdbi.v3.core.generic.GenericType;
049import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMapper;
050import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.ColumnMappers;
051import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.Mappers;
052import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMapper;
053import org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.RowMappers;
054import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
055
056import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
057
058/**
059 * The statement context provides access to statement-local configuration.
060 * Context is inherited from the parent {@link Handle} initially and changes will
061 * not outlive the statement.
062 * The context will be passed through most major jdbi APIs.
063 *
064 * DISCLAIMER: The class is not intended to be extended. The final modifier is absent to allow
065 * mock tools to create a mock object of this class in the user code.
066 */
067public class StatementContext implements Closeable {
068    private final ConfigRegistry config;
069    private final ExtensionMethod extensionMethod;
070
071    private final Set<Cleanable> cleanables = new LinkedHashSet<>();
072
073    private String rawSql;
074    private String renderedSql;
075    private ParsedSql parsedSql;
076    private PreparedStatement statement;
077    private Connection connection;
078    private Binding binding = new Binding(this);
079
080    private boolean returningGeneratedKeys = false;
081    private String[] generatedKeysColumnNames = new String[0];
082    private boolean concurrentUpdatable = false;
083
084    private Instant executionMoment;
085    private Instant completionMoment;
086    private Instant exceptionMoment;
087
088    StatementContext() {
089        this(new ConfigRegistry());
090    }
091
092    StatementContext(ConfigRegistry config) {
093        this(config, null);
094    }
095
096    StatementContext(ConfigRegistry config, ExtensionMethod extensionMethod) {
097        this.config = requireNonNull(config);
098        this.extensionMethod = extensionMethod;
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Gets the configuration object of the given type, associated with this context.
103     *
104     * @param configClass the configuration type
105     * @param <C>         the configuration type
106     * @return the configuration object of the given type, associated with this context.
107     */
108    public <C extends JdbiConfig<C>> C getConfig(Class<C> configClass) {
109        return config.get(configClass);
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Returns the {@code ConfigRegistry}.
114     *
115     * @return the {@code ConfigRegistry} used by this context.
116     */
117    public ConfigRegistry getConfig() {
118        return config;
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Returns the attributes applied in this context.
123     *
124     * @return the defined attributes.
125     */
126    public Map<String, Object> getAttributes() {
127        return getConfig(SqlStatements.class).getAttributes();
128    }
129
130    /**
131     * Obtain the value of an attribute
132     *
133     * @param key the name of the attribute
134     * @return the value of the attribute
135     */
136    public Object getAttribute(String key) {
137        return getConfig(SqlStatements.class).getAttribute(key);
138    }
139
140    /**
141     * Define an attribute for in this context.
142     *
143     * @param key   the key for the attribute
144     * @param value the value for the attribute
145     */
146    public void define(String key, Object value) {
147        getConfig(SqlStatements.class).define(key, value);
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Obtain an argument for given value in this context
152     *
153     * @param type  the type of the argument.
154     * @param value the argument value.
155     * @return an Argument for the given value.
156     */
157    public Optional<Argument> findArgumentFor(Type type, Object value) {
158        return getConfig(Arguments.class).findFor(type, value);
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * Obtain an argument for given value in this context
163     *
164     * @param type  the type of the argument.
165     * @param value the argument value.
166     * @return an Argument for the given value.
167     */
168    public Optional<Argument> findArgumentFor(QualifiedType<?> type, Object value) {
169        return getConfig(Arguments.class).findFor(type, value);
170    }
171
172    /**
173     * Returns the strategy used by this context to bind array-type arguments to SQL statements.
174     *
175     * @return the strategy used to bind array-type arguments to SQL statements
176     */
177    public SqlArrayArgumentStrategy getSqlArrayArgumentStrategy() {
178        return getConfig(SqlArrayTypes.class).getArgumentStrategy();
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Obtain an {@link SqlArrayType} for the given array element type in this context
183     *
184     * @param elementType the array element type.
185     * @return an {@link SqlArrayType} for the given element type.
186     */
187    public Optional<SqlArrayType<?>> findSqlArrayTypeFor(Type elementType) {
188        return getConfig(SqlArrayTypes.class).findFor(elementType);
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Obtain a mapper for the given type in this context.
193     *
194     * @param <T> the type to map
195     * @param type the target type to map to
196     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mappers
197     * is registered for the given type.
198     */
199    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findMapperFor(Class<T> type) {
200        return getConfig(Mappers.class).findFor(type);
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Obtain a mapper for the given type in this context.
205     *
206     * @param <T> the type to map
207     * @param type the target type to map to
208     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mappers
209     * is registered for the given type.
210     */
211    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findMapperFor(GenericType<T> type) {
212        return getConfig(Mappers.class).findFor(type);
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Obtain a mapper for the given type in this context.
217     *
218     * @param type the target type to map to
219     * @return a mapper for the given type, or empty if no row or column mappers
220     * is registered for the given type.
221     */
222    public Optional<RowMapper<?>> findMapperFor(Type type) {
223        return getConfig(Mappers.class).findFor(type);
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Obtain a mapper for the given qualified type in this context.
228     *
229     * @param type the target qualified type to map to
230     * @return a mapper for the given qualified type, or empty if no row or column mappers
231     * is registered for the given type.
232     */
233    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findMapperFor(QualifiedType<T> type) {
234        return getConfig(Mappers.class).findFor(type);
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type in this context.
239     *
240     * @param <T> the type to map
241     * @param type the target type to map to
242     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
243     */
244    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findColumnMapperFor(Class<T> type) {
245        return getConfig(ColumnMappers.class).findFor(type);
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type in this context.
250     *
251     * @param <T> the type to map
252     * @param type the target type to map to
253     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
254     */
255    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findColumnMapperFor(GenericType<T> type) {
256        return getConfig(ColumnMappers.class).findFor(type);
257    }
258
259    /**
260     * Obtain a column mapper for the given type in this context.
261     *
262     * @param type the target type to map to
263     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
264     */
265    public Optional<ColumnMapper<?>> findColumnMapperFor(Type type) {
266        return getConfig(ColumnMappers.class).findFor(type);
267    }
268
269    /**
270     * Obtain a column mapper for the given qualified type in this context.
271     *
272     * @param type the qualified target type to map to
273     * @return a ColumnMapper for the given type, or empty if no column mapper is registered for the given type.
274     */
275    public <T> Optional<ColumnMapper<T>> findColumnMapperFor(QualifiedType<T> type) {
276        return getConfig(ColumnMappers.class).findFor(type);
277    }
278
279    /**
280     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in this context.
281     *
282     * @param type the target type to map to
283     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
284     */
285    public Optional<RowMapper<?>> findRowMapperFor(Type type) {
286        return getConfig(RowMappers.class).findFor(type);
287    }
288
289    /**
290     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in this context.
291     *
292     * @param <T> the type to map
293     * @param type the target type to map to
294     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
295     */
296    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findRowMapperFor(Class<T> type) {
297        return getConfig(RowMappers.class).findFor(type);
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Obtain a row mapper for the given type in this context.
302     *
303     * @param <T> the type to map
304     * @param type the target type to map to
305     * @return a RowMapper for the given type, or empty if no row mapper is registered for the given type.
306     */
307    public <T> Optional<RowMapper<T>> findRowMapperFor(GenericType<T> type) {
308        return getConfig(RowMappers.class).findFor(type);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Obtain a collector for the given type.
313     *
314     * @param containerType the container type.
315     * @return a Collector for the given container type, or empty null if no collector is registered for the given type.
316     */
317    public Optional<Collector<?, ?, ?>> findCollectorFor(Type containerType) {
318        return getConfig(JdbiCollectors.class).findFor(containerType);
319    }
320
321    /**
322     * Returns the element type for the given container type.
323     *
324     * @param containerType the container type.
325     * @return the element type for the given container type, if available.
326     */
327    public Optional<Type> findElementTypeFor(Type containerType) {
328        return getConfig(JdbiCollectors.class).findElementTypeFor(containerType);
329    }
330
331    StatementContext setRawSql(String rawSql) {
332        this.rawSql = rawSql;
333        return this;
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Obtain the initial sql for the statement used to create the statement
338     *
339     * @return the initial sql
340     */
341    public String getRawSql() {
342        return rawSql;
343    }
344
345    void setRenderedSql(String renderedSql) {
346        this.renderedSql = renderedSql;
347    }
348
349    /**
350     * Obtain the rendered SQL statement
351     * <p>
352     * Not available until until statement execution time
353     * </p>
354     *
355     * @return the sql statement after processing template directives.
356     */
357    public String getRenderedSql() {
358        return renderedSql;
359    }
360
361    void setParsedSql(ParsedSql parsedSql) {
362        this.parsedSql = parsedSql;
363    }
364
365    /**
366     * Obtain the parsed SQL statement
367     * <p>
368     * Not available until until statement execution time
369     * </p>
370     *
371     * @return the sql statement as it will be executed against the database
372     */
373    public ParsedSql getParsedSql() {
374        return parsedSql;
375    }
376
377    void setStatement(PreparedStatement stmt) {
378        statement = stmt;
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Obtain the actual prepared statement being used.
383     * <p>
384     * Not available until execution time
385     * </p>
386     *
387     * @return Obtain the actual prepared statement being used.
388     */
389    public PreparedStatement getStatement() {
390        return statement;
391    }
392
393    StatementContext setConnection(Connection connection) {
394        this.connection = connection;
395        return this;
396    }
397
398    /**
399     * Obtain the JDBC connection being used for this statement
400     *
401     * @return the JDBC connection
402     */
403    public Connection getConnection() {
404        return connection;
405    }
406
407    StatementContext setBinding(Binding b) {
408        this.binding = b;
409        return this;
410    }
411
412    /**
413     * Returns the statement binding.
414     *
415     * @return The statement binding.
416     */
417    public Binding getBinding() {
418        return binding;
419    }
420
421    /**
422     * Sets whether the current statement returns generated keys.
423     * @param b return generated keys?
424     */
425    public void setReturningGeneratedKeys(boolean b) {
426        if (isConcurrentUpdatable() && b) {
427            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create a result set that is concurrent "
428                    + "updatable and is returning generated keys.");
429        }
430        this.returningGeneratedKeys = b;
431    }
432
433    /**
434     * Whether the statement being generated is expected to return generated keys.
435     *
436     * @return whether the statement being generated is expected to return generated keys.
437     */
438    public boolean isReturningGeneratedKeys() {
439        return returningGeneratedKeys || generatedKeysColumnNames.length > 0;
440    }
441
442    /**
443     * Returns the generated key column names or empty if none were generated.
444     *
445     * @return the generated key column names. Returns an empty array if none exist.
446     */
447    public String[] getGeneratedKeysColumnNames() {
448        return Arrays.copyOf(generatedKeysColumnNames, generatedKeysColumnNames.length);
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * Set the generated key column names.
453     * @param generatedKeysColumnNames the generated key column names
454     */
455    public void setGeneratedKeysColumnNames(String[] generatedKeysColumnNames) {
456        this.generatedKeysColumnNames = Arrays.copyOf(generatedKeysColumnNames, generatedKeysColumnNames.length);
457    }
458
459    /**
460     * Return if the statement should be concurrent updatable.
461     *
462     * If this returns true, the concurrency level of the created ResultSet will be
463     * {@link java.sql.ResultSet#CONCUR_UPDATABLE}, otherwise the result set is not updatable,
464     * and will have concurrency level {@link java.sql.ResultSet#CONCUR_READ_ONLY}.
465     *
466     * @return if the statement generated should be concurrent updatable.
467     */
468    public boolean isConcurrentUpdatable() {
469        return concurrentUpdatable;
470    }
471
472    /**
473     * Set the context to create a concurrent updatable result set.
474     *
475     * This cannot be combined with {@link #isReturningGeneratedKeys()}, only
476     * one option may be selected. It does not make sense to combine these either, as one
477     * applies to queries, and the other applies to updates.
478     *
479     * @param concurrentUpdatable if the result set should be concurrent updatable.
480     */
481    public void setConcurrentUpdatable(final boolean concurrentUpdatable) {
482        if (concurrentUpdatable && isReturningGeneratedKeys()) {
483            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot create a result set that is concurrent "
484                    + "updatable and is returning generated keys.");
485        }
486        this.concurrentUpdatable = concurrentUpdatable;
487    }
488
489    /**
490     * Returns the query execution start as an {@link Instant}.
491     *
492     * @return the {@link Instant} at which query execution began
493     */
494    @Nullable
495    public Instant getExecutionMoment() {
496        return executionMoment;
497    }
498
499    /**
500     * Sets the query execution start. This is not part of the Jdbi API and should not be called by
501     * code outside JDBI.
502     *
503     * @param executionMoment Sets the start of query execution.
504     */
505    public void setExecutionMoment(Instant executionMoment) {
506        this.executionMoment = executionMoment;
507    }
508
509    /**
510     * If query execution was successful, returns the query execution end as an {@link Instant}.
511     *
512     * @return the {@link Instant} at which query execution ended, if it did so successfully
513     */
514    @Nullable
515    public Instant getCompletionMoment() {
516        return completionMoment;
517    }
518
519    /**
520     * Sets the query execution end. This is not part of the Jdbi API and should not be called by
521     * code outside JDBI.
522     *
523     * @param completionMoment Sets the end of query execution.
524     */
525    public void setCompletionMoment(Instant completionMoment) {
526        this.completionMoment = completionMoment;
527    }
528
529    /**
530     * If query execution failed, returns the query execution end as an {@link Instant}.
531     *
532     * @return the {@link Instant} at which query execution ended, if it did so with an exception
533     */
534    @Nullable
535    public Instant getExceptionMoment() {
536        return exceptionMoment;
537    }
538
539    /**
540     * Sets the query execution end. This is not part of the Jdbi API and should not be called by
541     * code outside JDBI.
542     *
543     * @param exceptionMoment Sets the end of query execution.
544     */
545    public void setExceptionMoment(Instant exceptionMoment) {
546        this.exceptionMoment = exceptionMoment;
547    }
548
549    /**
550     * Convenience method to measure elapsed time between start of query execution and completion or exception as appropriate. Do not call with a null argument or before a query has executed/exploded.
551     * @param unit the time unit to convert to
552     * @return the elapsed time in the given unit
553     */
554    public long getElapsedTime(ChronoUnit unit) {
555        return unit.between(executionMoment, completionMoment == null ? exceptionMoment : completionMoment);
556    }
557
558    /**
559     * Registers a {@code Cleanable} to be invoked when the statement context is closed. Cleanables can be registered
560     * on a statement context, which will be cleaned up when
561     * the statement finishes or (in the case of a ResultIterator), the object representing the results is closed.
562     * <p>
563     * Resources cleaned up by Jdbi include {@link ResultSet}, {@link Statement}, {@link Handle},
564     * {@link java.sql.Array}, and {@link StatementBuilder}.
565     *
566     * @param cleanable the Cleanable to clean on close
567     */
568    public void addCleanable(Cleanable cleanable) {
569        cleanables.add(cleanable);
570    }
571
572    @Override
573    public void close() {
574        SQLException exception = null;
575
576        List<Cleanable> cleanablesCopy = new ArrayList<>(cleanables);
577        cleanables.clear();
578        Collections.reverse(cleanablesCopy);
579
580        for (Cleanable cleanable : cleanablesCopy) {
581            try {
582                cleanable.close();
583            } catch (SQLException e) {
584                if (exception == null) {
585                    exception = e;
586                } else {
587                    exception.addSuppressed(e);
588                }
589            }
590        }
591
592        if (exception != null) {
593            throw new CloseException("Exception thrown while cleaning StatementContext", exception);
594        }
595    }
596
597    public ExtensionMethod getExtensionMethod() {
598        return extensionMethod;
599    }
600
601    boolean isClosed() {
602        return cleanables.isEmpty();
603    }
604}
